If `n` is even and `a` is even, then `n % a` is even.

type: ∀ {n a : ℕ}, Even n → Even a → Even (n % a)
name: Even.mod_even
docString: If `n` is even and `a` is even, then `n % a` is even.

An integer `n` is even if and only if `n` modulo 2 equals 0.

name: Int.even_iff
docString: An integer `n` is even if and only if `n` modulo 2 equals 0.

This theorem states that for any integer `n`, `n` is even if and only if `n` modulo 2 equals 0. In other words, an integer `n` satisfies the property `Even`--meaning there exists some other integer `r` such that `n = r + r`--if and only if the remainder when `n` is divided by 2 is 0. This is a formalization of the usual mathematical definition of even numbers in the integers.

name: Int.even_iff
docString: This theorem states that for any integer `n`, `n` is even if and only if `n` modulo 2 equals 0. In other words, an integer `n` satisfies the property `Even`--meaning there exists some other integer `r` such that `n = r + r`--if and only if the remainder when `n` is divided by 2 is 0. This is a formalization of the usual mathematical definition of even numbers in the integers.

If `a` is even, then `n` is even iff `n % a` is even.

type: ∀ {n a : ℕ}, Even a → (Even (n % a) ↔ Even n)
name: Even.mod_even_iff
docString: If `a` is even, then `n` is even iff `n % a` is even.

A natural number `n` is even if and only if `n` modulo 2 equals 0.

name: Nat.even_iff
docString: A natural number `n` is even if and only if `n` modulo 2 equals 0.

This theorem states that for every integer `n`, the remainder when `n` is divided by 2 is either 0 or 1. In other words, if you take any integer `n` and calculate `n modulo 2`, the result will always be either 0 (if `n` is even) or 1 (if `n` is odd).

name: Int.emod_two_eq_zero_or_one
docString: This theorem states that for every integer `n`, the remainder when `n` is divided by 2 is either 0 or 1. In other words, if you take any integer `n` and calculate `n modulo 2`, the result will always be either 0 (if `n` is even) or 1 (if `n` is odd).

`div2 n = n/2`

name: Int.div2
docString: `div2 n = n/2`

The `n`th prime is greater or equal to `n + 2`.

name: Nat.add_two_le_nth_prime
docString: The `n`th prime is greater or equal to `n + 2`.

`div2 n = ⌊n/2⌋` the greatest integer smaller than `n/2`

name: Nat.div2
docString: `div2 n = ⌊n/2⌋` the greatest integer smaller than `n/2`

The sequence `n / (2 * n + 1)` tends to `1/2`

name: Stirling.tendsto_self_div_two_mul_self_add_one
docString: The sequence `n / (2 * n + 1)` tends to `1/2`

Multiplication modulo `n`

type: {n : ℕ} → Fin n → Fin n → Fin n
name: Fin.mul
docString: Multiplication modulo `n`

If `n` is odd and `a` is even, then `n % a` is odd.

type: ∀ {n a : ℕ}, Odd n → Even a → Odd (n % a)
name: Odd.mod_even
docString: If `n` is odd and `a` is even, then `n % a` is odd.

If `a` is even, then `n` is odd iff `n % a` is odd.

type: ∀ {n a : ℕ}, Even a → (Odd (n % a) ↔ Odd n)
name: Odd.mod_even_iff
docString: If `a` is even, then `n` is odd iff `n % a` is odd.

If for all `n ≠ 0 ∈ ℤ`, `n • A = A`, then `A` is divisible.

type: (A : Type u_1) → [inst : AddCommGroup A] → (∀ {n : ℤ}, n ≠ 0 → n • ⊤ = ⊤) → DivisibleBy A ℤ
name: AddCommGroup.divisibleByIntOfSMulTopEqTop
docString: If for all `n ≠ 0 ∈ ℤ`, `n • A = A`, then `A` is divisible.

name: Nat.evenOddStrongRec

Infinitely many natural numbers are equal to `d` mod `n`.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ}, n ≠ 0 → ∀ (d : ℕ), ∃ᶠ (m : ℕ) in Filter.atTop, m ≡ d [MOD n]
name: Nat.frequently_modEq
docString: Infinitely many natural numbers are equal to `d` mod `n`.

A (positive) natural number `n` is a sum of two squares if and only if the exponent of
every prime `q` such that `q % 4 = 3` in the prime factorization of `n` is even.
(The assumption `0 < n` is not present, since for `n = 0`, both sides are satisfied;
the right hand side holds, since `padicValNat q 0 = 0` by definition.)

type: ∀ {n : ℕ}, (∃ x y, n = x ^ 2 + y ^ 2) ↔ ∀ {q : ℕ}, Nat.Prime q → q % 4 = 3 → Even (padicValNat q n)
name: Nat.eq_sq_add_sq_iff
docString:
A (positive) natural number `n` is a sum of two squares if and only if the exponent of
every prime `q` such that `q % 4 = 3` in the prime factorization of `n` is even.
(The assumption `0 < n` is not present, since for `n = 0`, both sides are satisfied;
the right hand side holds, since `padicValNat q 0 = 0` by definition.)

If `m` and `n` are natural numbers, then the natural number `m^n` is even
if and only if `m` is even and `n` is positive.

type: ∀ {m n : ℕ}, Even (m ^ n) ↔ Even m ∧ n ≠ 0
name: Nat.even_pow
docString:
If `m` and `n` are natural numbers, then the natural number `m^n` is even
if and only if `m` is even and `n` is positive.

Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same divisors.

name: Nat.dvd_left_iff_eq
docString: Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same divisors.

A natural number `m` divides the sum `m + n` if and only if `m` divides `n`.

type: ∀ {m n : ℕ}, m ∣ m + n ↔ m ∣ n
name: Nat.dvd_add_self_left
docString: A natural number `m` divides the sum `m + n` if and only if `m` divides `n`.

A natural number is odd iff it has residue `1` or `3` mod `4`

name: Nat.odd_mod_four_iff
docString: A natural number is odd iff it has residue `1` or `3` mod `4`

If `n > 0` then `m` is not divisible by `n` iff it is between `n * k` and `n * (k + 1)`
for some `k`.

name: Int.exists_lt_and_lt_iff_not_dvd
docString:
If `n > 0` then `m` is not divisible by `n` iff it is between `n * k` and `n * (k + 1)`
for some `k`.
